toto.plugins.tide.detide¶

class toto.plugins.tide.detide.TideAnalysis(pandas_obj)[source]¶

Bases: object

detide(mag='mag', args={'folder out': '/home/remy/software/TOTO/Toto/docs', 'latitude': - 36.0, 'minimum SNR': 2})[source]¶

This function detide a timeseries using Utide software. Usefull if NaNs are in the timeseries

magstr

Name of the column from which to extract the tide

args: dict
Dictionnary with the folowing keys:

minimum SNR: int folder out: str

Path to save the output

latitude: float

>>> df=tf['test1']['dataframe'].TideAnalysis.detide(mag='U',args={'latitude':-36.5})
>>>
predict(mag='mag', args={'dt(s)': 60, 'latitude': -36.0, 'maximum time': <class 'datetime.datetime'>, 'minimum SNR': 2, 'minimum time': <class 'datetime.datetime'>})[source]¶

This function predict the tide by first detiding a timeseries. Works if NaN are in the timeseries

magstr

Name of the column from which to extract the tide

args: dict
Dictionnary with the folowing keys:

Minimum SNR: int folder out: str

Path to save the output

latitude: float minimum time: datetime

Time the time series start

maximum time: datetime

Time the time series end

dt(s): int

Time interval in seconds

>>> df=tf['test1']['dataframe'].TideAnalysis.predict(mag='U',args={'latitude':-36.5,            'minimum time':datetime.datetime(2002,1,1),'maximum time':datetime.datetime(2003,1,1),            'dt(s)':3600)
>>>
recreate(args={'column amp': 'amp', 'column cons': 'cons', 'column pha': 'pha', 'cons file': '/home/remy/software/TOTO/Toto/docs/cons_list.txt', 'dt(s)': 3600, 'latitude': - 36.0, 'maximum time': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 6, 21, 56, 18, 966734), 'minimum time': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 30, 21, 56, 18, 966731)})[source]¶
Re-create a time series using a file containing

Amplitude and Phase for each contituents.

args: dict
Dictionnary with the folowing keys:
cons file: str

Txt file containing the amplitude and phase

column cons: str

Name of the column containing the constituent name

column amp: str

Name of the column containing the constituent amplitude

column pha: str

Name of the column containing the constituent phase (in degree)

minimum time: datetime

Time the time series start

maximum time: datetime

Time the time series end

dt(s): int

Time interval in seconds

latitude: float

>>> df=tf['test1']['dataframe'].TideAnalysis.recreate(args={'cons file':'test.txt',        'column cons':'cons','column amp':amp,'column pha':pha,        'minimum time':datetime.datetime(2002,1,1),'maximum time':datetime.datetime(2003,1,1),        'dt(s)':3600,'latitude':-36)
>>>
skew_surge(mag='mag', args={'latitude': - 36.0, 'minimum SNR': 2})[source]¶

This function calculate the skew surge : see https://www.ntslf.org/storm-surges/skew-surges

magstr

Name of the column from which to extract the tide

args: dict
Dictionnary with the folowing keys:

minimum SNR: int latitude: float

>>> df=tf['test1']['dataframe'].TideAnalysis.skew_surge(mag='U',args={'latitude':-36.5})
>>>
tidal_stat(mag='mag', args={'folder out': '/home/remy/software/TOTO/Toto/docs', 'latitude': - 36.0, 'minimum SNR': 2})[source]¶
Function to extract the tide stats from a time series

i.e HAT,LAT,MHWS,MLWS…

magstr

Name of the column from which to extract the tide

args: dict
Dictionnary with the folowing keys:

minimum SNR: int folder out: str

Path to save the output

latitude: float

>>> df=tf['test1']['dataframe'].TideAnalysis.tidal_stat(mag='U',args={'latitude':-36.5})
>>>
